node.title: Thailand welcomes first international tourists as Bangkok-based Australians plan Christmas homecomings
node.description: As Thailand allows its first visitors in 18 months to skip hotel quarantine, Bangkok-based Australians are looking to take advantage of the relaxing of restrictions and opening of borders to be reunited with loved ones.
node.content:
["Thailand has given the green light to vaccinated travellers from more than 60 countries in a move that coincides with the opening of some of Australia's international borders.", "It means that many Thailand-based Australians will be\u00a0able to fly home for festive family reunions with the knowledge they can easily return after the holidays.\u00a0\u00a0", "From Monday, Bangkok Airport welcomed\u00a0the first wave of visitors to Thailand in 18 months who will not have to undergo hotel quarantine for coronavirus.", "In addition to Australia, the 60-nation list includes New Zealand, the US, China, Japan, India and most of Europe.", "Under the new national program, arrivals must spend their first night in a pre-approved hotel and receive a negative COVID-19 test before they are able to travel freely to the rest of Thailand.", "Before the pandemic, tourism accounted for about 12 per cent\u00a0of the nation's\u00a0GDP and Bangkok\u00a0was the world's most visited city.", "The resumption of commercial flights and the relaxing\u00a0of quarantine rules are also good news\u00a0for Australians living and working in the Land of Smiles.\u00a0", "
'Looking forward to jumping on a Sydney train'
", "", "
Tim Whitwell (right) and family celebrate the Songkran festival in Bangkok in April this year.(Supplied: Tim Whitwell)
", "Bangkok-based businessman Tim Whitwell will now be\u00a0reunited with his wife and daughters for Christmas.", "\"I'm\u00a0super chuffed to be able to book a commercial flight home after so many months of uncertainty,\" Mr Whitwell told the ABC.", "\"Despite our best efforts, there were no guarantees just a couple of weeks ago, and, who knows, it could have been February and we\u2019d still be waiting.\"", "Mr Whitwell, who works for a Danish multi-national company managing its supply chain,\u00a0has booked a Thai Airways flight to Sydney for December 17 and will return to Bangkok on January 16.", "He is planning a family reunion at Niagara Park, near Gosford, on New South Wales' Central Coast.", "", "
Mr Whitwell (left) said he and wife Lisa went through months of \"uncertainty\" over flights.(Supplied:\u00a0Tim Whitwell)
", "His wife Lisa and younger\u00a0daughters Lucy, 11, and Matilda, 13, flew to Australia on October 6 on a federal government-arranged repatriation flight.", "\"Given the uncertainty and difficulty in getting flights during the pandemic, we grabbed three seats when we could, but my wife and daughters had to go through hotel quarantine,\" he said.", "\"I'm looking forward to being able to land in Sydney, jump on a train to Gosford and be with family under the same roof again. Our older daughters, Hannah and Eliza, will be there too.", "
'Haven't hugged grandchildren in three years'
", "", "
Thailand resident Mark Weber says he hasn't seen his Queensland-based grandchildren in almost three years.(Supplied: Mark Weber)
", "But for Bangkok-based school teacher, Mark Weber, it will make\u00a0little difference to his holiday plans because most of his family are based in Brisbane and Cairns.", "Queensland will only fully open its state borders on December 17, with some quarantine rules to remain\u00a0for international arrivals, making it more difficult for returning Queenslanders.", "\"I haven't hugged my grandchildren in almost three years, so it's hard to know that I won't be able to do it this Christmas,\" Mr Weber told the ABC.", "\"Watching from a distance, it's clear that Australia is not a united country but a federation of states, with so many different rules for\u00a0international arrivals.\"", "Mr Weber, who has lived in Asia since 2013, is the middle school principal at the International School of Myanmar. He has been teaching remotely from Bangkok but will move to Yangon on November 10 to continue his role in person.", "\"You go where the work is, but moving to Myanmar will mean that I'm further away from home, with less prospect of getting back to Australia any time soon.\"", "Thailand continues to deal with surging coronavirus cases driven by the Delta strain, adding to the complexities\u00a0of welcoming back tourists during a pandemic.", "The majority of Thailand's 1.9 million infections and more than 19,000 fatalities have been recorded since April.", "", "
A Thai classical dancer wears a\u00a0face shield to help curb the spread of COVID-19 at the Erawan Shrine in Bangkok.(AP: Sakchai Lalit)
", "Around 42 per cent\u00a0of the nation's 72 million population has been vaccinated, according to government figures.", "
Australia-Indonesia travel lane discussed
", "Bali, another popular travel destination for Australians, remains off-limits for now.", "But Indonesian media reports that President Joko Widodo met with\u00a0Prime Minister Scott Morrison on the sidelines of the G20 summit in Rome to discuss the establishment of a vaccinated travel lane (VTL) between the two nations.", "\"Hopefully, the VTL and vaccine certificate recognition can be completed soon. I am sure that this will accelerate the economic recovery, of course in a safe manner,\u201d Mr Widodo was quoted as saying.", "The Thai finance ministry said it expected\u00a0only a gradual return to international tourism, with\u00a0180,000 foreign arrivals predicted this year, and 7 million visitors next year.", "That's compared with more than 40 million arrivals in 2019.", "Even so, Mr Weber said\u00a0even a modest resumption\u00a0would provide a much-needed boost for his fellow Bangkok residents.", "\"I think it\u2019s great that everything is opening up and it's about the right time, especially for the Thai people.\"", "", "

", "ABC/Reuters"]
